file_content.text: On the ground, safe and sound, everyone. Clearance code says there is a Commander Tritan in charge.
The planet awaits, my lord. Commander Tritan will want to meet with you.
End of the line, everybody out. You've got a meeting with Commander Tritan.
My briefing said I was to meet a Colonel Vannis.
Commander? Not Colonel?
Uh... I don't know anything about that. Commander Tritan's the one listed as in charge now.
I don't answer calls from anyone less than a Moff.
He can wait.
Well, I hope one of your friends here can take the meeting. Apparently, Commander Tritan's all we have left.
Uh... you may want to make an exception today, my lord. Commander Tritan's all we have listed, unless you count the Chiss.
Uh... I don't know how to tell you this, but Commander Tritan's all we have listed, unless you count the Chiss.
I'm sure he can fill you in on the story. I need to de-ice the shuttle here.
Sounds good.
He'll be happy to see reinforcements. Good luck on the planet, all.
He's well-trained, they say. I hope he pulls through, for the sake of the base. Good luck on the planet, my lord.
He's fresh out of the Academy, but he's supposed to be good. Good luck on the planet, sir.
Shuttle to the space station, leaving in a moment. You ready?
Shuttle at your command, my lord. Shall we depart?
Shuttle at your command, sir. You want a ride to somewhere warm?
Let's go.
Yes.
All aboard.
Very good, my lord.
Good. I can't feel my feet.
Not yet.
No.
Then I recommend standing somewhere out of the wind.
